place: Victoria Palace Hotel, 6 rue Blaise Des goffe, Paris (Montparnasse)
author: James Joyce
text: Dear Fleischman: I am sorry you could not dine with us before you sailed. I hope you will find Mrs Fleischman quite recovered from her illness. Will you please give her our kind regards. As we spoke about my American publisher I enclose a letter which I will ask you to return. You will see that in one year not a single copy of A Portrait of the Artist has been sold in the United States. My annual income apparently from sales in America is about 30$. Sincerely yours James Joyce
